org.safs.persist

Class PersistorToString

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.persist.PersistableChecker
      • org.safs.persist.AbstractPersistor
        • org.safs.persist.PersistorToString
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Persistor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PersistorToHierarchialString

    public abstract class PersistorToString
extends AbstractPersistor
    This class is used to convert a Persistable object to a string and convert a string to a Persistable object.
    The string format will depends on the sub-class's implementation.
    Author:
    Lei Wang

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void beforeUnpickle()

      protected java.lang.String escape(java.lang.String value)
      When writing a string to a file, some special characters MUST be escaped, such as new line "\n", "\r", "\r\n", or double quote ", or <?XML>...</XML> etc.
      What characters to escape and how to escape, these depend on the format of the persistence file, and the parser of the file.
      java.lang.String getPersistenceName()
      The name of the persistence material holding the content of an Object.
      It can be a file name or a variable name etc.
      It could be useful when deleting the persistence.

      protected boolean stringNeedQuoted()

      JSON file requires that for string value.
      In JSON file, For example:
      "key" : "stringValue" is good
      "key" : stringValue is bad

      • stringFormat

        protected java.lang.StringBuilder stringFormat

      • stringFormatReader

      • ignoredFieldsForUnpickle

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> ignoredFieldsForUnpickle
        Holding the fields which are ignored for each class. No need to unpickle.
        The field is expressed as a pair of (classname, a list of fields).
        See Also:
        #isIgnoredFiled(String)

      • stringNeedQuoted

        protected boolean stringNeedQuoted()
        If the string value needs to be quoted before writing into a kind of persistence.
        JSON file requires that for string value.
        In JSON file, For example:
        "key" : "stringValue" is good
        "key" : stringValue is bad
        Returns:
        boolean true if the value needs to be quoted before writing into persistence.

      • escape

        protected java.lang.String escape(java.lang.String value)
        When writing a string to a file, some special characters MUST be escaped, such as new line "\n", "\r", "\r\n", or double quote ", or <?XML>...</XML> etc.
        What characters to escape and how to escape, these depend on the format of the persistence file, and the parser of the file. Subclass should override this method.
        This method will also quote the value if stringNeedQuoted() returns true.
        Parameters:
        value - String, the value to escape.
        Returns:
        String, the escaped string
        See Also:
        stringNeedQuoted()

      • unpersist

        public void unpersist()
               throws SAFSException

        Specified by:

      • getPersistenceName

        public java.lang.String getPersistenceName()
        Description copied from interface: Persistor
        The name of the persistence material holding the content of an Object.
        It can be a file name or a variable name etc.
        It could be useful when deleting the persistence.
